  17. (* Handling of symbol tables (globals and events) *)

  19. open Instruct
  20. open Debugger_config (* Toplevel *)
  21. open Program_loading
  22. open Debugcom
  23. open Events
  24. module String = Misc.Stdlib.String

  26. ‌let modules =
  27.   ref ([] : string list)

  29. ‌let program_source_dirs =
  30.   ref ([] : string list)

  32. ‌let events_by_pc =
  33.   (Hashtbl.create 257 : (pc, debug_event) Hashtbl.t)
  34. ‌let events_by_module =
  35.   (Hashtbl.create 17 : (string, int * debug_event array) Hashtbl.t)
  36. ‌let all_events_by_module =
  37.   (Hashtbl.create 17 : (string, int * debug_event list) Hashtbl.t)

  39. ‌let partition_modules evl =
  40.   let rec partition_modules' ev evl =
  41.     match evl with
  42.       [] -> [ev],[]
  43.     | ev'::evl ->
  44.        let evl,evll = partition_modules' ev' evl in
  45.        if ev.ev_module = ev'.ev_module then ev::evl,evll else [ev],evl::evll
  46.   in
  47.   match evl with
  48.     [] -> []
  49.   | ev::evl -> let evl,evll = partition_modules' ev evl in evl::evll

  51. ‌let relocate_event orig ev =
  52.   ev.ev_pos <- orig + ev.ev_pos;
  53.   match ev.ev_repr with
  54.     Event_parent repr -> repr := ev.ev_pos
  55.   | _                 -> ()

  57. ‌let read_symbols' bytecode_file =
  58.   let ic = open_in_bin bytecode_file in
  59.   let toc =
  60.     try
  61.       let toc = Bytesections.read_toc ic in
  62.       ignore(Bytesections.seek_section toc ic Bytesections.Name.SYMB);
  63.       toc
  64.     with Bytesections.Bad_magic_number | Not_found ->
  65.       prerr_string bytecode_file; prerr_endline " is not a bytecode file.";
  66.       raise Toplevel
  67.   in
  68.   Symtable.restore_state (input_value ic);
  69.   begin try
  70.     ignore (Bytesections.seek_section toc ic Bytesections.Name.DBUG)
  71.   with Not_found ->
  72.     prerr_string bytecode_file; prerr_endline " has no debugging info.";
  73.     raise Toplevel
  74.   end;
  75.   let num_eventlists = input_binary_int ic in
  76.   let dirs = ref String.Set.empty in
  77.   let eventlists = ref [] in
  78.   for _i = 1 to num_eventlists do
  79.     let orig = input_binary_int ic in
  80.     let evl = (input_value ic : debug_event list) in
  81.     (* Relocate events in event list *)
  82.     List.iter (relocate_event orig) evl;
  83.     let evll = partition_modules evl in
  84.     eventlists := evll @ !eventlists;
  85.     dirs :=
  86.       List.fold_left (fun s e -> String.Set.add e s) !dirs (input_value ic)
  87.   done;
  88.   begin try
  89.     ignore (Bytesections.seek_section toc ic Bytesections.Name.CODE)
  90.   with Not_found ->
  91.     (* The file contains only debugging info,
  92.        loading mode is forced to "manual" *)
  93.     set_launching_function (List.assoc "manual" loading_modes)
  94.   end;
  95.   close_in_noerr ic;
  96.   !eventlists, !dirs

  98. ‌let clear_symbols () =
  99.   modules := [];
  100.   program_source_dirs := [];
  101.   Hashtbl.clear events_by_pc; Hashtbl.clear events_by_module;
  102.   Hashtbl.clear all_events_by_module

  104. ‌let add_symbols frag all_events =
  105.   List.iter
  106.     (fun evl ->
  107.       List.iter
  108.         (fun ev ->
  109.           Hashtbl.add events_by_pc {frag; pos = ev.ev_pos} ev)
  110.         evl)
  111.     all_events;

  113.   List.iter
  114.     (function
  115.         [] -> ()
  116.       | ev :: _ as evl ->
  117.           let md = ev.ev_module in
  118.           let cmp ev1 ev2 = compare (Events.get_pos ev1).Lexing.pos_cnum
  119.                                     (Events.get_pos ev2).Lexing.pos_cnum
  120.           in
  121.           let sorted_evl = List.sort cmp evl in
  122.           modules := md :: !modules;
  123.           Hashtbl.add all_events_by_module md (frag, sorted_evl);
  124.           let real_evl =
  125.             List.filter
  126.               (function
  127.                  {ev_kind = Event_pseudo} -> false
  128.                | _                        -> true)
  129.               sorted_evl
  130.           in
  131.           Hashtbl.add events_by_module md (frag, Array.of_list real_evl))
  132.     all_events

  134. let read_symbols frag bytecode_file =
  135.   let all_events, all_dirs = read_symbols' bytecode_file in
  136.   program_source_dirs := !program_source_dirs @ (String.Set.elements all_dirs);
  137.   add_symbols frag all_events

  139. ‌let erase_symbols frag =
  140.   let pcs = Hashtbl.fold (fun pc _ pcs ->
  141.       if pc.frag = frag then pc :: pcs else pcs)
  142.     events_by_pc []
  143.   in
  144.   List.iter (Hashtbl.remove events_by_pc) pcs;

  146.   let mds = Hashtbl.fold (fun md (frag', _) mds ->
  147.       if frag' = frag then md :: mds else mds)
  148.     events_by_module []
  149.   in
  150.   List.iter (Hashtbl.remove events_by_module) mds;
  151.   List.iter (Hashtbl.remove all_events_by_module) mds;
  152.   modules := List.filter (fun md -> not (List.mem md mds)) !modules

  154. let code_fragments () =
  155.   let frags =
  156.     Hashtbl.fold
  157.       (fun _ (frag, _) l -> frag :: l)
  158.       all_events_by_module []
  159.   in
  160.   List.sort_uniq compare frags

  162. ‌let modules_in_code_fragment frag' =
  163.   Hashtbl.fold (fun md (frag, _) l ->
  164.       if frag' = frag then md :: l else l)
  165.     all_events_by_module []

  167. ‌let any_event_at_pc pc =
  168.   { ev_frag = pc.frag; ev_ev = Hashtbl.find events_by_pc pc }

  170. ‌let event_at_pc pc =
  171.   match any_event_at_pc pc with
  172.     { ev_ev = { ev_kind = Event_pseudo } } -> raise Not_found
  173.   | ev -> ev

  175. ‌let set_event_at_pc pc =
  176. try ignore(event_at_pc pc); set_event pc
  177. with Not_found -> ()

  179. (* List all events in module *)
  180. ‌let events_in_module mdle =
  181.   try
  182.     Hashtbl.find all_events_by_module mdle
  183.   with Not_found ->
  184.     0, []

  186. (* Binary search of event at or just after char *)
  187. ‌let find_event ev char =
  188.   let rec bsearch lo hi =
  189.     if lo >= hi then begin
  190.       if (Events.get_pos ev.(hi)).Lexing.pos_cnum < char
  191.       then raise Not_found
  192.       else hi
  193.     end else begin
  194. ‌      let pivot = (lo + hi) / 2 in
  195. ‌      let e = ev.(pivot) in
  196.       if char <= (Events.get_pos e).Lexing.pos_cnum
  197.       then bsearch lo pivot
  198.       else bsearch (pivot + 1) hi
  199.     end
  200.   in
  201.   if Array.length ev = 0 then
  202.     raise Not_found
  203.   else
  204.     bsearch 0 (Array.length ev - 1)

  206. (* Return first event after the given position. *)
  207. (* Raise [Not_found] if module is unknown or no event is found. *)
  208. ‌let event_at_pos md char =
  209.   let ev_frag, ev = Hashtbl.find events_by_module md in
  210.   { ev_frag; ev_ev = ev.(find_event ev char) }

  212. (* Return event closest to given position *)
  213. (* Raise [Not_found] if module is unknown or no event is found. *)
  214. ‌let event_near_pos md char =
  215.   let ev_frag, ev = Hashtbl.find events_by_module md in
  216.   try
  217.     let pos = find_event ev char in
  218.     (* Desired event is either ev.(pos) or ev.(pos - 1),
  219.        whichever is closest *)
  220.     if pos > 0 && char - (Events.get_pos ev.(pos - 1)).Lexing.pos_cnum
  221.                   <= (Events.get_pos ev.(pos)).Lexing.pos_cnum - char
  222.     then { ev_frag; ev_ev = ev.(pos - 1) }
  223.     else { ev_frag; ev_ev = ev.(pos) }
  224.   with Not_found ->
  225.     let pos = Array.length ev - 1 in
  226.     if pos < 0 then raise Not_found;
  227.     { ev_frag; ev_ev = ev.(pos) }

  229. (* Flip "event" bit on all instructions *)
  230. ‌let set_all_events frag =
  231.   Hashtbl.iter
  232.     (fun pc ev ->
  233.        match ev.ev_kind with
  234.          Event_pseudo -> ()
  235.        | _ when pc.frag = frag -> set_event pc
  236.        | _ -> ())
  237.     events_by_pc

  239. (* Previous `pc'. *)
  240. (* Save time if `update_current_event' is called *)
  241. (* several times at the same point. *)
  242. let old_pc = ref (None : pc option)

  244. (* Recompute the current event *)
  245. let update_current_event () =
  246.   match Checkpoints.current_pc () with
  247.     None ->
  248.       Events.current_event := None;
  249.       old_pc := None
  250.   | (Some pc) as opt_pc when opt_pc <> !old_pc ->
  251.       Events.current_event :=
  252.         begin try
  253.           Some (event_at_pc pc)
  254.         with Not_found ->
  255.           None
  256.         end;
  257.       old_pc := opt_pc
  258.   | _ ->
  259.       ()
